dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools
dependencies.name: autoconf

dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools
dependencies.name: automake

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: c

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: cxx

dependencies.description:
DRAMsim is a hardware-validated, cycle-accurate C based simulator for
DRAM devices such as DDR3
dependencies.name: dramsim2

dependencies.description:
DRAMsim3 models the timing paramaters and memory controller behavior for
several DRAM protocols such as DDR3, DDR4, LPDDR3, LPDDR4, GDDR5, GDDR6,
HBM, HMC, STT-MRAM. It is implemented in C++ as an objected oriented
model that includes a parameterized DRAM bank model, DRAM controllers,
command queues and system-level interfaces to interact with a CPU
simulator (GEM5, ZSim) or trace workloads. It is designed to be
accurate, portable and parallel.
dependencies.name: dramsim3

dependencies.description: FlashDIMMSim: a reasonably accurate flash DIMM simulator.
dependencies.name: flashdimmsim

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: fortran

dependencies.description: GNU internationalization (i18n) and localization (l10n) library.
dependencies.name: gettext

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description:
The Goblin HMC-Sim is a Hybrid Memory Cube Functional Simulation
Environment
dependencies.name: goblin-hmc-sim

dependencies.description: HBM Simulator based on DRAMSim2
dependencies.name: hbm-dramsim2

dependencies.description:
HybridSim provides cycle-accurate simulation of a non-volatile memory
system augmented with a DRAM based cache. It uses DRAMSim2 for the DRAM
model and NVDIMMSim for the non-volatile memory model
dependencies.name: hybridsim

dependencies.description:
Intel Pin is a dynamic binary instrumentation framework for the IA-32,
x86-64 and MIC instruction-set architectures that enables the creation
of dynamic program analysis tools.
dependencies.name: intel-pin

dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.
dependencies.name: libtool

dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.
dependencies.name: m4

dependencies.description: IBM MPI implementation from Spectrum MPI.
dependencies.name: mpi

dependencies.description:
NVDIMMSim is a cycle-accurate non-volatile memory simulator for devices
such as NAND flash
dependencies.name: nvdimmsim

dependencies.description:
To improve scalability for very large and massively parallel traces the
Open Trace Format (OTF) is developed at ZIH as a successor format to the
Vampir Trace Format (VTF3).
dependencies.name: otf

dependencies.description:
The Open Trace Format 2 is a highly scalable, memory efficient event
trace data format plus support library.
dependencies.name: otf2

dependencies.description: The Python programming language.
dependencies.name: python

dependencies.description:
Ramulator is a fast and cycle-accurate DRAM simulator that supports a
wide array of commercial, as well as academic, DRAM standards.
dependencies.name: ramulator

dependencies.description:
The Structural Simulation Toolkit (SST) core provides a parallel
discrete event simulation (PDES) framework for performing architecture
simulations of existing and proposed HPC systems
dependencies.name: sst-core

dependencies.description:
The DUMPI package provides libraries to collect and read traces of MPI
applications. Traces are created by linking an application with a
library that uses the PMPI interface to intercept MPI calls. DUMPI
records signatures of all MPI-1 and MPI-2 subroutine calls, return
values, request information, and PAPI counters.
dependencies.name: sst-dumpi

dependencies.description: zlib replacement with optimizations for next generation systems.
dependencies.name: zlib-api

description:
SST Elements implements a range of components for performing
architecture simulation from node-level to system-level using the SST
discrete event core.
name: sst-elements

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
